definitions.definition: an arithmetical value, expressed by a word, symbol, or figure, representing a particular quantity and used in counting and making calculations and for showing order in a series or for identification.

examples: the boy was adept at numbers
the company is seeking to increase the number of women on its staff
synonyms: tally; quota "a large number of complaints"

examples: we have discussed the matter on a number of occasions
synonyms: sundry "she's collected a number of ashtrays"

definitions.definition: a group or company of people.
examples: there were some distinguished names among our number
synonyms: gang "the wedding of one of their number"

definitions.definition: a large quantity or amount, often in contrast to a smaller one; numerical preponderance.
examples: the weight of numbers turned the battle against them

definitions.definition: a single issue of a magazine.
a song, dance, piece of music, etc., especially one of several in a performance.
examples: they go from one melodious number to another

definitions.definition: a thing, typically an item of clothing, of a particular type, regarded with approval or admiration.
examples: Yvonne was wearing a little black number

definitions.definition: a distinction of word form denoting reference to one person or thing or to more than one.
amount to (a specified figure or quantity); comprise.
synonyms: come to "visitors numbered more than two million"

definitions.definition: include or classify as a member of a group.
examples: the orchestra numbers Brahms among its past conductors
synonyms: deem "he numbers her among his friends"

definitions.definition: mark with a number or assign a number to, typically to indicate position in a series.

examples: strategies like ours can be numbered on the fingers of one hand
synonyms: tot up; formalenumerate "he numbers the fleet at a thousand"
